channel.title: Those who stayed with rock or heavy metal
channel.description:
Those who stayed with rock or heavy metal/alternative rock/hard rock, (instead of going to gay rap)
What is the best bands?
Tell us your top five...
Mine are: Three Days Grace Blank Theory Papa Roach Sum 41 Red Jumpsuit Apparatus ---------------------- ---------------------- favorite song--
I Hate Everything About You by Three Days Grace

item.description:
@Vahuka wrote:

Why is it that Bullet for my valentine and Fallout boy and Panic! at the disco now rock/metal?

MY top 10 any way,

  1. SlipKnot
  2. KillSwitch Engage
  3. Shadows Fall
  4. Avenged Sevenfold
  5. Trivium
  6. Stone Sour
  7. Disturbed
  8. Godsmack
  9. Metallica
  10. Slayer[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 07, 2007, 04:55:29 PM[/size][hr]Anyway, who cares about lyrics? it’s the song anyway, take a look at the legendary guitar god: BUCKETHEAD

item.title: Those who stayed with rock or heavy metal
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

Let’s just settle this little genre slap fight by acknowledging that music tastes vary from person to person. I agree, some lyrics suck and there isn’t any argument about that. I think we can all agree when this occurs most: when a band, rapper, whatever, sells out. All I can do is preach diversity. Bored of rock at the moment? Pick up some rap or trance. I won’t advocate modern country music; that’s just abuse of a guitar. Don’t agree? That’s totally cool. Stop being so damn intolerant of other genres. You’re hardly better than akisboy32 when you do this shit: he suicide-bombed people not in his religion, you flame people with musical tastes differing from your own.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

I’ve listened to plenty of rock songs to know it’s not all like that, but I’ve found plenty of them like it. I’ve listened to plenty of songs about how a mans life goes downhill and how they came into fame from nothing. Almost everything now is hip-hop bullshit with a different tittle on it.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

exe626:

A few hand select bands does not own the genre, remember that.

Oh and I do know that. I gave a few examples of what proper metal is.
You should really listen to your own advice, because you heard a few songs in rock about their bad lives, you said all rock is like that.
Now isn’t that silly?

-Mh

item.source: Those who stayed with rock or heavy metal

item.title: Those who stayed with rock or heavy metal
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

exe626:

Man. This is such a bias argument. I’m not saying one is better than the other, I’m not saying every song in the rock genre is all about how bad their lives are(but it usually is…). Don’t freak out when I say something about your precious rock. Most metal bands I like, but some of them I can’t stand the lyrics. Not like I can’t understand them, but they throw their words around more than most of the new hip-hop shit that people call rap. ‘Death Metal’ is not touching, it’s usually vial and horrible, swearing to kill.

How can you say it’s bias when I’ve defended both rock and rap? Nor am I freaking out. I have a valid point.
(Melodic) Death metal, and (symphonic) power metal are good examples of emotional lyrics. Nightwish, CoB and Kalmah are very good examples of that, which is why they are so famous. They’re instrumental parts are good, so are the lyrics.

-Mh

Read full topic

item.description:

I’m not saying one is better than the other, I’m not saying every song in the rock genre is all about how bad their lives are(but it usually is…). Don’t freak out when I say something about your precious rock. Most metal bands I like, but some of them I can’t stand the lyrics. Not like I can’t understand them, but they throw their words around more than most of the new hip-hop shit that people call rap. ‘Death Metal’ is not touching, it’s usually vial and horrible, swearing to kill.[/quote]Actually most Death Metal is about today’s society. Band such as Pestilence, Cynic, Death and Atheist have very good lyrics, and they are the biggest death metal bands around.

Read full topic

item.title: Those who stayed with rock or heavy metal
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Monster Hack, post:27, topic:162259”]You can’t say rap is only about beatin’ up hoes and gangstas, nor can you say rock is all about how bad their lives are… Where the hell did you get that from (about rock). Mainstream rap is all about that shit, but neither mainstream rock or the good rock are about how bad their lives are. There’s the occaisional song about something tragic in their live, but not how bad it is.

-Mh[/quote]Yeah, that’s mostly the emo-scene (which is stupid and pathetic anyway). Most Metal bands have good lyrical content behind the music, take a look at “Death” for example. It’s probably my favourite metal lyrics out there, extremely deep and touching.

Read full topic

item.title: Those who stayed with rock or heavy metal
item.dc:creator: @Divine-Devil Divine-Devil
item.description:
@Divine-Devil wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:22, topic:162259”][quote author=exe626 link=topic=220686.msg1915227#msg1915227 date=1196895416]
I like both, but I like from rock/metal genre:

Slipknot
Black Sabbath
Children of Bodom
Cradle of Filth
and Lamb of God I suppose

But those are more modern(as in, they’ve sung recently), I prefer older rock when it actually sounded good. Like Metallica and ACDC in their prime.

OP: Your a narrow minded son of a bitch that has no respect nor decency to accept more than one genre of music. Rap(the real rap, not this bullshit hip-hop you listen too) takes skill, it takes time. To rap you have to write a story with your words; rock just screams and sings about how bad their lives are. Rap takes a more positive turn, they sing of money and such(usually hip-hop does this). Listen to these songs and tell me rap sucks:

Just ignore the videos

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W6S7dAsIzIU
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kExHaBkEYi8
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JNcloTmvTeA
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wl54ABY8VgY

Feel free to look up more, I just grabbed a few I liked and listen to frequently.
[/quote]Now tell me if that bolded part wasn’t narrow-minded ;)[/quote]

That is…But…

[quote=“exe626, post:17, topic:162259”]I like both, but I like from rock/metal genre:

Slipknot
Black Sabbath
Children of Bodom
Cradle of Filth
and Lamb of God I suppose

But those are more modern(as in, they’ve sung recently), I prefer older rock when it actually sounded good. Like Metallica and ACDC in their prime.

OP: Your a narrow minded son of a bitch that has no respect nor decency to accept more than one genre of music. Rap(the real rap, not this bullshit hip-hop you listen too) takes skill, it takes time. To rap you have to write a story with your words; rock just screams and sings about how bad their lives are. Rap takes a more positive turn, they sing of money and such(usually hip-hop does this). Listen to these songs and tell me rap sucks:

Just ignore the videos

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W6S7dAsIzIU
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kExHaBkEYi8
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JNcloTmvTeA
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wl54ABY8VgY

Feel free to look up more, I just grabbed a few I liked and listen to frequently.[/quote]

is not 100% true, They talk about money,right? But how did they get that money?.. Stealing cars, and killing people, or selling drugs, and talk about how they mis-treat girls, and sex, and the list continues, but, Not ALL songs are like that, maybe 99.1% of it is?

Read full topic
